resourceAbstractObject.default: The main objectives of the project are to 1) identify the geographical origin(s) of poppy including the location(s) of its wild progenitor(s) and of its domestication, 2) define a chrono-cultural framework for its early domestication process and dispersal from Prehistory to the end of the Iron Age (6000-50 cal BC). Using archaeological material, as well as sampling of modern biodiversity kept in seed banks, this pioneering project involves several disciplines – archaeobotany, dating techniques, genomics, geometric morphometric methods, spatial analysis – to elucidate the role of the opium poppy in Europe’s natural and cultural heritage. The project is financed by the Fondation Fyssen (2018), the ANR (ANR-21-CE27-0006, 2022-2025) and the FCT (PTDC/HAR-ARQ/1709/2021, 2022-2024).

Using archaeological material, as well as sampling of modern biodiversity kept in seed banks, this pioneering project involves several disciplines – archaeobotany, dating techniques, genomics, geometric morphometric methods, spatial analysis – to elucidate the role of the opium poppy in Europe’s natural and cultural heritage. The project is financed by the Fondation Fyssen (2018), the ANR (ANR-21-CE27-0006, 2022-2025) and the FCT (PTDC/HAR-ARQ/1709/2021, 2022-2024).

resourceTitleObject.default: POPPY : A cross-disciplinary project to reveal the origin and early diffusion of the opium poppy in Europe and Southwest Asia
resourceTitleObject.langeng: POPPY : A cross-disciplinary project to reveal the origin and early diffusion of the opium poppy in Europe and Southwest Asia
